item.title: Danny Dyer's 'Have I Got News For You' Stint Really Divided Viewers - HuffPost UK
item.description:
Danny Dyer's 'Have I Got News For You' Stint Really Divided Viewers  HuffPost UK

Following his Brexit rant earlier this year, Danny Dyer seemed like the perfect choice to guest host ‘Have I Got News For You’ - or so producers might have thought. The ‘EastEnders’ actor’s turn at the helm of the comedy panel show actually really divided viewers on Friday night. While many loved his trademark banter, others were less impressed by his presenting ability. Some branded him “wooden” as he tried to crack topical gags on the BBC show. How wooden is Danny Dyer - Dier #hignfy — Paul (@Porl1878) December 7, 2018 I didn’t think an Eastenders actor could get any more wooden, but Dann...

item.title: Danny Dyer hosts Have I Got News for You, review: guest host hits his stride with nimble wit and salty quips - The Telegraph
item.description:
Danny Dyer hosts Have I Got News for You, review: guest host hits his stride with nimble wit and salty quips  The Telegraph

“I forgot how highbrow this f***ing show is.” So said guest host Danny Dyer on Have I Got News For You(BBC One).The EastEnders star’s industrial language and nimble natural wit made for a uproarious installment of the hoary old satirical quiz. Roguish Cockney thesp Dyer has enjoyed a gratifying career turnaround in recent years, transforming himself from bargain-bin action hero to televisual treasure by virtue of his award-winning, soap-salvaging role as Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter and cockle-warming discovery of his royal roots on Who Do You Think You Are? Dyer also has new-found form f...

item.title: Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham split after six months - The Independent
item.description:
Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham split after six months  The Independent

Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have announced their separation just over four months after winning Love Island 2018. After a whirlwind six-month relationship, Dyer revealed the news in a statement that she shared on her Instagram story. “Jack and I have sadly decided to part ways,” she wrote. - Read more Why girls should be able to watch ‘Love Island’ and still be feminists “It’s been an incredible six months, and we will always have a place in our hearts for each other, but sadly we’ve come to the realisation that it’s not meant to be long term. “We both plan to stay friends. I hope you’ll all...

item.title: Dani Dyer And Jack Fincham Split Four Months After Winning Love Island - HuffPost UK
item.description:
Dani Dyer And Jack Fincham Split Four Months After Winning Love Island  HuffPost UK

Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have split four months after being crowned winners of Love Island. The pair, who have been filming a reality show about their life together, parted ways six months after becoming a couple in the first weeks of the ITV show. Dyer confirmed the pair’s split in a message posted to her Instagram story, in which she said they had realised their relationship was “not meant to be long term”. She added she and Fincham, 27, planned to stay friends and urged their fans to be understanding of the situation. Dani and Jack have broken up. pic.twitter.com/5hUl5iT7q0 — vic sanus...

item.title: Love Island's Jack and Dani Have Split Up – Why Do I Care So Friggin' Much? - HuffPost UK
item.description:
Love Island's Jack and Dani Have Split Up – Why Do I Care So Friggin' Much?  HuffPost UK

Dani Dyer confirmed it, quietly, on her Instagram stories, after a series of plugs for some sequinned tops from her Pretty Little Thing range. “It’s been an incredible 6 months, and we will always have a place in our hearts for each other, but sadly we’ve come to the realisation that it’s not meant to be longterm,” she wrote. And then the sign-off: “I hope you’ll all understand.” With that “all” (oh hell, it’s probably what did them in), Dani recognised that there were more than two people in her relationship with Jack Fincham. There were 4.1 million. And many of them are in mourning today....

item.description:

Danny Dyer, man of the people, has unleashed his wrath on Brexiteers Boris Johnson and Nigel Farage, where he attacked the former foreign secretary for "spouting bollocks" and branded Farage "a p***k in a suit". Speaking to the Big Issue, the EastEnders actor launched an extraordinary rant on the current state of British politics, and lamented the "age of food banks". "Theresa May, bless her, just got that job by default," he said. "Boris Johnson running around with his stupid haircut spouting bollocks. Young people look and think: 'If these are the people running the country, why shouldn't...

I do love the boy, but, like, things gotta change round here.” Emily’s sp...

item.title: BBC Salaries: ‘EastEnders’ Stars’ Pay Revealed With Danny Dyer And Adam Woodyatt Among Top Earners - HuffPost UK
item.description:
BBC Salaries: ‘EastEnders’ Stars’ Pay Revealed With Danny Dyer And Adam Woodyatt Among Top Earners  HuffPost UK

The salaries of the ‘EastEnders’ cast have been revealed in a new BBC report, which includes the wages of all of the broadcaster’s actors, presenters and radio hosts earning more than £150,000. Unsurprisingly, a number of the soap’s actors fall into this category and, for the first time, we can now see which stars are earning more than others. The report places actors into pay brackets, and Laurie Brett (who plays Jane Beale), Linda Henry (Shirley Carter), Scott Maslen (Jack Branning), Letitia Dean (Sharon Mitchell), Tameka Empson (Kim Fox-Hubbard) and Diane Parish (Denise Fox) are among th...

item.title: 'EastEnders' Bosses Address Mick Carter 'Racist' Slur - The Huffington Post UK
item.description:
'EastEnders' Bosses Address Mick Carter 'Racist' Slur  The Huffington Post UK

‘EastEnders’ bosses have issued a statement after some viewers were upset character Mick Carter used a “racist” slur in a recent episode. Danny Dyer’s character was heard using the term “eyetie” to describe an Italian-themed night his son Johnny had hosted at the Queen Vic on Tuesday (10 January). He said: “He’s obviously talking about this, you know, eyetie night we’re meant to be having. Johnny giving it all the live-like-a-native spiel.” The term is a derogatory way of describing an Italian person that was used after the country joined forced with Germany during the Second World War. May...

item.title: National TV Awards: Danny Dyer terrifies Scarlett Moffatt, Mary Berry is the loveliest person on TV and Helen George's curious dress - The Telegraph
item.description:
National TV Awards: Danny Dyer terrifies Scarlett Moffatt, Mary Berry is the loveliest person on TV and Helen George's curious dress  The Telegraph

I used to be snobbish about The National TV Awards. Call this a celebration of the best of the year’s television, I used to think. Pish, where is Stephen Poliakoff’s nomination? Or the award for best BBC Four documentary about major arts figures from the Weimar Republic? Then, I lightened up when I realised that the National TV Awards is not an awards ceremony but an entertainment show with a bit of light gong-giving. The event, which took place at the building formerly known as the Millennium Dome, included an introductory groove thang from Tom Jones, a lady bagpiper’s rendition of Island...

item.title: Stop it, Sherlock! Five TV tropes that need to die - The Guardian
item.description:
Stop it, Sherlock! Five TV tropes that need to die  The Guardian

Related: Sherlock: how the TV phenomenon became an annoying self-parody The idiosyncratic pathologist Where: Sherlock, the cast of Silent Witness, Endeavour We get it. A pathologist is someone who willingly spends their working day with the dead so must be unusual or offbeat in some way. They can’t just be ordinary folk, trying to do a job. No, they must be “other” and possibly on the spectrum, although it’s never said. Dr Nikki Alexander (Emilia Fox) in Silent Witness is the cool, unemotional bone-kicker with no home life at all. The only place she can find romance is at the office, which ...

item.description:
Richard Blackwood Claims 'EastEnders' Cast Have 'No Idea' When Danny Dyer Is Returning  The Huffington Post UK

’EastEnders’ star Richard Blackwood has claimed the cast are in the dark about Danny Dyer’s current break from the soap. The Vincent Hubbard actor has revealed his co-stars have not been told when Danny will be back on set, amid on-going reports about both his private and professional lives. Speaking to The Sun, Richard said: “I’ve got no idea when Danny is coming back to work. “It’s not been mentioned, and to be honest we are just getting on with things. “We’ve professionals and we’re getting on with the job.” A source previously claimed that Danny wouldn’t be away from Albert Square for t...

item.title: Jonathan Ross And Other Celeb Parents Get Real About What Having Children Is Really Like - The Huffington Post UK
item.description:

Danny Dyer, Jonathan Ross, Frankie Boyle, Freddie Flintoff and Sally Phillips have opened up about the state of their home for the new series of Channel 4’s ‘Parenting For Idiots’. Most parents will know only too well that having a house full of children is not a clean affair: from the baby vomit on every item of clothing, to the shards of Lego hidden in the carpet waiting to cripple you. So how do celebrities and Instagram parents keep their lives looking quite so mess-free? The short answer is, they don’t. The first episode, aptly titled ‘Mass Destruction’ focuses on chaos, mess, germs an...

The biggest stars in British television were out in force on Sunday (14 May) for the 63rd annual Bafta TV Awards. Celebrating the best of 2016’s small screen offerings, the nation’s favourite actors, presenters and entertainers all descended on the Royal Festival Hall on London’s Southbank. But before the awards - this year presented by former ‘Great British Bake Off’ host Sue Perkins - were handed out, there was the small matter of the red carpet. item.title: It's not just Danny Dyer who is related to royalty - we all are, geneticist says - The Telegraph
item.description:
It's not just Danny Dyer who is related to royalty - we all are, geneticist says  The Telegraph

Being related to royalty is no big deal, a BBC presenter has said, because "literally every person in Europe is directly descended from Charlemagne". Adam Rutherford, a geneticist who presents the Radio 4 programme Inside Science, said his calculations reveal that almost every Briton is related to the 14th century king Edward III. He told an audience at the Chalke Farm History Festival that his team had worked out that the chance that someone born in the 1970s was not related to Edward III was vanishingly small, at 0.0000000000000000000000000001 . Literally every person in Europe is directl...

item.title: Danny Dyer Gets Typically Candid As He Dismisses His Sex Symbol Status - The Huffington Post UK
item.description:
Danny Dyer Gets Typically Candid As He Dismisses His Sex Symbol Status  The Huffington Post UK

Danny Dyer has downplayed his status as a sex symbol, despite being named among the hottest men in soap in the past. Speaking to The Sun, he dismissed the suggestion that ‘EastEnders’ viewers would be going gooey-eyed every time his character stepped behind the bar of the Queen Vic. He joked: “I don’t get the sexiest man thing. I’ve got 18 chins, man boobs and I’m too hairy. “I also struggle to do my pants up. Surely people can see past the looks… I’m really not worthy competition for any sexiest male awards.” Danny went on to suggest that ‘EastEnders’ viewers’ affections towards him were m...

item.description:

Linda Carter made an all-too-brief return to ‘EastEnders’ on Thursday (16 March) night, as she discovered the secrets husband Mick has been hiding from her. The Queen Vic landlady has been nursing her sick mother Elaine in recent months, while actress Kellie Bright has been on maternity leave. However, she staged a surprise comeback to the Square during Thursday’s (16 March) episode, after receiving a worrying phone call from Jane Beale. item.description:

Danny Dyer’s EastEnders’ castmates are reportedly concerned the actor is set to quit the BBC soap for good after it was confirmed he’s on an extended break from the show. item.description:
Shia LaBeouf's £7 stinker, and the truth about UK box office flops  The Telegraph

The news of certain UK box office flops are usually greeted with breathlessly dire proclamations about the career misfortunes of their stars -- the most recent being Shia LaBeouf, whose war veteran thriller Man Down reportedly grossed a staggering £7 in its opening weekend in the UK. But Man Down's unrelenting floppage was slightly exaggerated, its cinema takings (which reportedly equalled just one ticket sold) likely not helped by the film being released across video-on-demand services on the same date. These "day-and-date" releases ensure that distributors only need to pay for advertising...

item.title: The 40 funniest tweets of 2015 - The Telegraph
item.description:
The 40 funniest tweets of 2015  The Telegraph

We take a subjective look back at some of the best one-liners, sharpest witticisms and biggest fails seen on Twitter in 2015. - The 40 funniest tweets of 2014 - The 40 funniest tweets of 2013 40. This Tesco shopper is peak Glaswegian @Haraam_ Hi Haraam, I'm really sorry about that, can you tell me which store this was in please? - Owen #Regards — Tesco (@Tesco) March 23, 2015 @Tesco am no a grass — Shayaatin. (@Haraam_) March 23, 2015 39. David Whitley wants answers Just out of interest, @british_airways, when was the last time you *weren't* experiencing "extremely high call volumes"? — ...

item.title: Danny Dyer trolled by BBC Planet Earth iguana over TV Baftas awards loss - The Telegraph
item.description:
Danny Dyer trolled by BBC Planet Earth iguana over TV Baftas awards loss  The Telegraph

Danny Dyer loses out to the BBC's Planet Earth II for TV Moment of the Year at the 2017 Baftas. The award for the nature documentary series' 'iguana vs snake' scene is accepted by an iguana in a hilarious video message directed at Dyer. The actor was hoping to pick up a gong for his appearance in Who Do You Think You Are? in which he discovers his remarkable links to royalty. item.title: EastEnders under fire for 'anti-Brexit' episode - The Independent
item.description:
EastEnders under fire for 'anti-Brexit' episode  The Independent

The writers behind last night’s EastEnders episode have been forced to defend themselves after being labelled ‘anti-Brexit’ by fans of the show. During the episode, residents of Walford graffitied the message "Poles Go Home" on the Queen Vic following a Polish-themed night at the pub. After Danny Dyer’s character Mick Carter expressed shock at the incident, Piotr Baumann’s Konrad said how it's "the Britain we live in now”. While some viewers were impressed with EastEnders for bringing up topical political issues, others were annoyed the BBC would show Brexit voters as being Xenophobic. The ...

item.title: ‘EastEnders’ Spoilers: Danny Dyer Isn’t Going Anywhere, Spokesperson Insists - HuffPost UK
item.description:
‘EastEnders’ Spoilers: Danny Dyer Isn’t Going Anywhere, Spokesperson Insists  HuffPost UK

For the third time in just two weeks, an ‘EastEnders’ spokesperson has been forced to deny that one of the soap’s stars is leaving the show. This time, it’s Danny Dyer who is in the spotlight, with reports claiming that the actor “fears” he could face the axe following John Yorke’s takeover as the soap’s executive producer. The Sun claimed that Danny had been chatting to his pals about his concerns, but fans needn’t worry as an ‘EastEnders’ spokesperson has already rubbished the claims. They told the Metro: “There is absolutely no truth in this story. Danny is a consummate professional and ...
